metadata.title: CVE-2020-27827 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in multiple versions of OpenvSwitch. Specially craftedLLDP packets can cause memory to be lost when allocating data to handlespecific optional TLVs, potentially causing a denial of service. Thehighest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27827` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvswitch-common - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
openvswitch-pki - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
openvswitch-source - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
openvswitch-switch - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
openvswitch-switch-dpdk - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
openvswitch-test - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
openvswitch-testcontroller - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
openvswitch-vtep - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
python3-openvswitch - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openvswitch package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3').
lldpd package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
